page.title: 07FARMING IN HARRIS
page.content: In Harris there are no farms such as those existing on the mainland.Instead agricultural land is divided into crofts.The average croft is 8 hectares.The Crofters'Commission is the body which administers the laws concerning crofts.A recent development offering financial aid for croft improvements is the Integrated Development Programme(IDP)Crofters usually keep sheep.Some also keep cattle.Most of the hay for winter feeding is grown on the croft.Root crops,especially potatoes,are also grown.As the land is so hilly,most work is done by hand.Another crop produced in the area is fish. Salmon and trout are reared on fish farms for sale to mainland markets. Shellfish farming,mainly mussels,takes place in sheltered bays.Clams(Scallops)are also harvested from inshore waters.
